description.narrative: By end 2017, systems are strengthened to deliver quality education that improves learning outcomes and promotes social cohesion and inclusion for girls and boys

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Sri Lanka Country Programme Action Plan
Sri Lanka Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Overview)
UNICEF Programmes in Sri Lanka (Emergency Response)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Sri Lanka: Evaluability assessment of the UNICEF Sri Lanka Country Programme
Sri Lanka 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Sri Lanka 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Sri Lanka 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2017, systems are strengthened to deliver quality education that improves learning outcomes and promotes social cohesion and inclusion for girls and boys

description.narrative: UNICEF piloted the Multi-Level (ML) Teaching and Learning approach in targeted provinces. In the East and North, almost 300 schools have been using ML materials in Grade 2 benefitting more than 10,000 children. UNICEF also continued supporting the integration of peace education and social cohesion into curricular/co-curricular activities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Education Policy on Social Cohesion is revised through a participatory process and includes a costed action plan-policy quality (Policy not reviewed and revised (0 points), policy reviewed (1 point), policy revised based on review (1 point), policy revised in a participatory manner (1 point), revised policy includes an action plan (1 point), revised policy includes a costed action plan (1 point)

actual.value: 2017:Policy was reviewed and an action plan without cost estimates developed through a participatory manner.

title.narrative: Education Policy on Social Cohesion is revised through a participatory process and includes a costed action plan-policy implementation (revised policy not submitted (0 points), revised policy submitted for approval (1 point), revised policy approved (1 point), revised policy implimented (1 point)

actual.value: 2017:Technical Committees have been established for specific thematic areas and some of the activities are being implemented.

title.narrative: % of schools in targeted provinces (East, North, Uva & N.Eliya) scoring at least 50 in the School Education Quality Index (SEQI)

actual.value: 2017:Data for 2017 will be available only by mid-December 2018 by the Ministry of Education

title.narrative: Peacebuilding, conflict and/or disaster risk reduction integrated in national curricula in primary and secondary education

baseline.value: Current curricula does not adequately integrate peace education and delivery of content needs to be strengthened.

target.value: 2017:Grade 3 curricula revised to integrate peace education in-line with the grade-wise revision cycle.

actual.value: 2017:Grade 3 curricula revised and supplementary material developed (game board incorporated into teacher instruction manual)

title.narrative: b2a. Availability, in schools supported by UNICEF, of quality CFS/CFE standards that are consistent with Child Friendly Schools/education or similar models - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Quality teacher standards are developed and piloted

target.value: 2017:Score 3: National quality standards on pedagogy, learning environment, school ethos and community involvement, and infrastructure and design are based on/reflect significantly most of the 4 CFS principles. The standards are mostly incorporated into teacher training programmes, school inspection guidelines, SMC training, and are fully implemented in most target schools.

actual.value: 2017:Score 3: National quality standards on pedagogy, learning environment, school ethos and community involvement, and infrastructure and design are based on/reflect significantly most of the 4 CFS principles. The standards are mostly incorporated into teacher training programmes, school inspection guid
